item.content:encoded:
Nikhil Beats is an up-and-coming Artist and Producer from East London. Drawing from a wide variety of influences, Nikhil has crafted a unique, hard-to-pin-down sound which reflects the multi-cultural society he grew up in. Featuring on tracks which make it to the playlists of future-facing 1Xtra DJ Jamz Supernova, Nikhil has also recently released his first solo EP 3000 Realms to critical acclaim.

Nikhil: I started making music when I was a kid, learnt the piano and then started writing songs when I was 12 or 13. Music is something I’ve always loved and always wanted to do, there’s never been anything else I wanted to do as much, although at one point I was contemplating studying Quantum Physics at Uni…but I’m happy I stuck with the music.

My influences growing up vary from loads of different places, just everything that was around me. Bollywood music has influenced me a lot, all the music that my parents would play.

My dad was really into Funk, House, Disco and Soul, my mum was into Jazz and Classical, while my older sister would play me Grime, Garage and old school R&B.

When I made 3000 Realms I can’t say I really had a process, it was more or less just making some music. It was during lockdown and artists couldn’t meet and have sessions, so I thought I’d just make some music and make something that would stand on its own without other artists… it started off as just instrumental tracks. As things opened up I just started putting things together, it was quite natural and I didn’t really think too much about it. An idea would just come into my head and I’d act on it, “Make a video” so I’d make a video etc… next thing I know I’ve got two music videos and singles and it was a fully formed project. A lot of it is just not putting up mental blocks in your own head and allowing the creativity to flow when you’re in that phase.

Music is more than a full time job, its more than enough to keep me busy and I do it for work and play. I’m a Buddhist and that takes up a lot of my time, I chant as part of my practice, go to meetings and readings. As I’m quite intense with my work, in my downtime I just like to sit with my people… hang-out or go for a bike ride, just chill with friends and family.

There’s this Japanese composer called Joe Hisaishi, he’s the guy who wrote the music for the Studio Ghibli film Howls Moving Castle. I think the music is so beautiful, completely out of my genre of but it would be mad work with him. In 5 years time I want my music to be global, I’d like my music to help me travel the world and work with international artists, just meeting and connecting with people.
